alert.note: Alert for Butler (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 18 at 10:11AM CST until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Missouri... Black River at Poplar Bluff affecting Butler County. .The heavy rainfall from Thursday, combined with expected snow and ice melt upstream will cause rises on the Black River at Poplar Bluff. Although river levels are currently expected to remain just below minor flood stage, those persons with interests near the river should remain alert for any changes in the forecast crest this weekend and into early next week. For the Black River...including Poplar Bluff...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Black River at Poplar Bluff. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. If the water continues to rise, Hillcrest Park will be affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.7 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to 15.5 feet early Monday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
